comment._content: @ joshyincy - you dare to doubt The Word of The Great LIFEASDADDY? !! He spent hours looking at dreary old newspapers (in the State Library?) and his findings are published above. Unfortunately 1899 Sydney Morning Heralds are not yet available on the net to link to, 'tho Google News is getting close - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2925973802/ But here is more proof. The Persistent URL resolution has improved since six months ago (new Zoomit) so the posters are a little clearer. www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=28177 . The HERALD poster's second last line says "[??] WINNING HORSE" which implies Wednesday 8th November 1899. ( I am using a large magnifying glass.) Also, the line above "[CY]CLONE AT NEWCASTLE". A quick google of "cyclone at newcastle november 1899" produced this result. It occurred on Tuesday 7th November, and would have been news the following day. newspapers.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/3238224?searchTerm= I think the Sydney Mail was a weekly publication (6d). The poster for it says "NOW READY". I have been trying to find out what day of the week it was published. I am betting on Wednesdays!
